summary: This bill, the "New Era of Preventing End-Stage Kidney Disease Act," aims to improve the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of rare kidney diseases. It establishes Centers of Excellence for research, funds studies on diagnostic methods like urinalysis and genetic testing, and explores factors contributing to the disease. The bill also includes provisions for provider education, nephrology fellowships, and experiments to delay or eliminate the need for dialysis and transplant. It authorizes appropriations for these initiatives and mandates reports to Congress.
